title: Ticket #7224: condor_token_create UI issues
description:
Maria and I noticed the following UI issues in condor_token_create:

  1. You can specify the -identity flag twice, but there's no reason why that should be a valid operation. This led to surprising results.
  2. -authz does not accept a comma-separated list; one has to specify the flag multiple times.
  3. -authz also accepts nonsensical strings that are not real authorization levels. The log messages on failure refer to the command name that failed, but not the authorization level that is missing. If the admin copy/pastes the command name (as is natural), then the token isn't going to work...
